Backhouse, C.; Barr, G.; Barrett, W.L.; Arms, K.E.; Adamson, P.; Andreopoulos, C.; Ayres, D.S.; Barnes, P.D., Jr.; Becker, B.R.; Armstrong, R.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="506" ind1=" " ind2="0"><subfield code="a">Free-to-read</subfield><subfield code="f">Unrestricted online access</subfield><subfield code="2">star</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1="3" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">This letter reports on a search for ν{sub μ} → ν{sub e} transitions by the MINOS experiment based on a 3.14 x 10²° protons-on-target exposure in the Fermilab NuMI beam. We observe 35 events in the Far Detector with a background of 27 ± 5(stat.) ± 2(syst.) events predicted by the measurements in the Near Detector. If interpreted in terms of ν{sub μ} → ν{sub e} oscillations, this 1.5 σ excess of events is consistent with sin²(2θ₁₃) comparable to the CHOOZ limit when </subfield><subfield code=" ">= 2.43 x 10⁻³ eV² and sin² (2θ₂₃) = 1.0 are assumed.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="536" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="b">AC02-07CH11359</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="650" ind1=" " ind2="7"><subfield code="a">Physics Of Elementary Particles And Fields.</subfield><subfield code="2">edbsc</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="653" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield "fermilab-pub-09-443-e" "arXiv eprint number arXiv:0909.4996" Submitted to Phys.Rev.Lett. 103 26 ISSN 0031--9007 FT Auty, D.J.; Backhouse, C.; Barr, G.; Barrett, W.L.; Arms, K.E.; Adamson, P.; Andreopoulos, C.; Ayres, D.S.; Barnes, P.D., Jr.; Becker, B.R.; Armstrong, R. Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star This letter reports on a search for ν{sub μ} → ν{sub e} transitions by the MINOS experiment based on a 3.14 x 10²° protons-on-target exposure in the Fermilab NuMI beam. We observe 35 events in the Far Detector with a background of 27 ± 5(stat.) ± 2(syst.) events predicted by the measurements in the Near Detector. If interpreted in terms of ν{sub μ} → ν{sub e} oscillations, this 1.5 σ excess of events is consistent with sin²(2θ₁₃) comparable to the CHOOZ limit when  = 2.43 x 10⁻³ eV² and sin² (2θ₂₃) = 1.0 are assumed.
